attributes.action: Change the dates that fireworks can be sold to limit distress caused to animals.
attributes.additional_details: If the dates are revised then animal owners will be able to better prepare for popular firework events - Bonfire Night and New Years Eve. The number of nights that fireworks are set off by the public could be massively reduced if they are not as easily accessible. This will help to limit the distress that is caused to so many animals predominantly between the months of October - January. There have been incidents in which have animals have died due to the distress caused by continuous fireworks.
attributes.background:
The government should revise the dates that fireworks can be sold to the public. My understanding is registered sellers can sell them between 15th Oct - 10th Nov, 26th - 31st Dec and from licensed shops all year round. Proposed different dates for ALL sellers-
 1st - 6th Nov 
28th - 31st Dec

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions which call for similar actions: 

Ban all firework sales except the days of November 5th And December 31st: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555746

Make it illegal for fireworks to be set off on days other than Nov 5 and Dec 31: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559397
